member.name: T:Lite.Caching.EventCache
member.summary: A cache for events that a stored for actors that join a game later. The key is the event code, the value the event content. The event cache is ordered by event code.

member.summary: Tries to create a new room.
member.param: The peer that holds this reference.
When this method returns true, contains a new for the room with the specified room id; otherwise, set to null.

member.returns: False if the cache contains a room with the specified room id; otherwise, true.

member.name: M:Lite.Caching.RoomCacheBase.ReleaseRoomReference(Lite.Caching.RoomReference)
member.summary: Releases a room reference. The related room instance will be removed from the cache if no more references to the room exists.

member.name: M:Lite.Caching.RoomCacheBase.TryRemoveRoomInstance(Lite.Room)
member.summary: Tries to remove a romm instance from the room cache. The room will only be removed if there are no references to the romm instance left.
member.returns: Returns true if the room was removed from the cache; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Lite.Caching.RoomCacheBase.CreateRoom(System.String,System.Object[])
member.summary: Must be implementated by inheritors to create new room instances. This method is called when a room reference is requesteted for a room that does not exists in the cache.
member.param: Optionally arguments used for room creation.

member.name: M:Lite.Caching.RoomCacheBase.OnRoomRemoved(Lite.Room)
member.summary: Invoked if the last reference for a room is released and the room was removed from the cache. Can be overloaded by inheritors to provide a custom cleanup logic after a room has been disposed.
member.param: The that was removed from the cache.

member.name: T:Lite.Caching.RoomReference
member.summary: Used to observe references to room instances from a room cache. A reference to a room should be released (disposed) if it is not longer needed. The related cache observes the number of references to a room and removes a room if it has no references left.
member.remarks: In the Lite application the room reference will be stored in a peers state property whern the peer joines a room. When a peer leaves a room the reference to the room will be disposed. This pattern ensures that room/game instances will not be disposed if there are still peers/clients holding a reference to the room/game.

member.name: F:Lite.Caching.RoomReference.id
member.summary: The id.

member.name: F:Lite.Caching.RoomReference.roomCache
member.summary: The room cache.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: An instance which obtained the room reference.

member.name: M:Lite.Caching.RoomReference.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class. Releases unmanaged resources and performs other cleanup operations before the is reclaimed by garbage collection.

member.name: M:Lite.Caching.RoomReference.Dispose
member.summary: Removes the room reference from the associated room cache. The related room instance will be removed from the cache if no more references to the room exists.

member.name: M:Lite.Caching.RoomReference.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: Gets the unique id for this instance.

member.value: true if this instance is disposed; otherwise, false.

member.summary: Gets or sets the room of this reference.

member.name: T:Lite.Room
member.summary: A room has s, can have properties, and provides an with a few wrapper methods to solve otherwise complicated threading issues: All actions enqueued to the are executed in a serial order. Operations of all Actors in a room are handled via ExecutionFiber.

member.name: F:Lite.Room.Log
member.summary: An instance used to log messages to the logging framework.

member.name: F:Lite.Room.name
member.summary: The room name.

member.name: M:Lite.Room.#ctor(System.String,Lite.Caching.RoomCacheBase,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class without a room name.
member.param: The instance to which the room belongs.
A value indicating how long the room instance will be keeped alive in the room cache after all peers have left the room.

member.name: M:Lite.Room.#ctor(System.String,ExitGames.Concurrency.Fibers.PoolFiber,Lite.Caching.RoomCacheBase,System.Int32)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The execution fiber used to synchronize access to this instance.
The instance to which the room belongs.
A value indicating how long the room instance will be keeped alive in the room cache after all peers have left the room.

member.name: M:Lite.Room.Finalize
member.summary: Finalizes an instance of the class. This destructor will run only if the Dispose method does not get called. It gives your base class the opportunity to finalize. Do not provide destructors in types derived from this class.

member.name: M:Lite.Room.BeforeRemoveFromCache
member.summary: Called by the if the room is about to be removed from the cache.
member.returns: True if the room should be automaticly by removed by the . False if the room has an custom remove implementation and will remove itself from the cache.
member.remarks: The default implementation checks if the EmptyRoomLiveTime value is set to a value greater zero. If it's set the method will return false to indicate that the cache should not remove this instance automaticly. The removal of the room is then scheduled using the .

member.name: M:Lite.Room.EnqueueMessage(Lite.Messages.IMessage)
member.summary: Enqueues an to the end of the execution queue.
member.remarks: is called sequentially for each operation request stored in the execution queue. Using an execution queue ensures that messages are processed in order and sequentially to prevent object synchronization (multi threading).

member.name: M:Lite.Room.EnqueueOperation(Lite.LitePeer,Photon.SocketServer.OperationRequest,Photon.SocketServer.SendParameters)
member.summary: Enqueues an to the end of the execution queue.
member.remarks: is called sequentially for each operation request stored in the execution queue. Using an execution queue ensures that operation request are processed in order and sequentially to prevent object synchronization (multi threading).

member.name: M:Lite.Room.ScheduleMessage(Lite.Messages.IMessage,System.Int64)
member.summary: Schedules a message to be processed after a specified time.
member.param: The time in milliseconds to wait before the message will be processed.

member.summary: Releases resources used by this instance.

member.name: M:Lite.Room.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases unmanaged and - optionally - managed resources
member.param: true to release both managed and unmanaged resources; false to release only unmanaged resources.

member.summary: This method is invoked sequentially for each operation request enqueued in the using the method.

member.returns: The newly created (joined) actor or null if the peer already joined.

member.summary: Removes a peer from the game. This method is called if a client sends a or disconnects.

member.returns: Returns true if no actor exists for the specified peer and a new actor for the peer has been successfully added. The actor parameter is set to the newly created instance. member.name: T:Lite.LitePeer
member.summary: Inheritance class of . The LitePeer dispatches incoming s at OnOperationRequest. When joining a a is stored in the property. An guarantees that all outgoing messages (events/operations) are sent one after the other.

member.name: F:Lite.LitePeer.log
member.summary: An instance used to log messages to the logging framework.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.#ctor(Photon.SocketServer.IRpcProtocol,PhotonHostRuntimeInterfaces.IPhotonPeer)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.ValidateOperation(Photon.SocketServer.Rpc.Operation,Photon.SocketServer.SendParameters)
member.summary: Checks if a operation is valid. If the operation is not valid an operation response containing a desciptive error message will be sent to the peer.
member.returns: true if the operation is valid; otherwise false.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.GetRoomReference(Lite.Operations.JoinRequest)
member.summary: Called by to get a room reference for a join operations. This method can be overloaded by inheritors to provide custom room references.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.HandleGameOperation(Photon.SocketServer.OperationRequest,Photon.SocketServer.SendParameters)
member.summary: Enqueues game related operation requests in the peers current game.
member.remarks:
The current for a peer is stored in the peers state property. Using the method ensures that all operation request dispatch logic has thread safe access to all room instance members since they are processed in a serial order.
Inheritors can use this method to enqueue there custom game operation to the peers current game.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.HandleJoinOperation(Photon.SocketServer.OperationRequest,Photon.SocketServer.SendParameters)
member.summary: Handles the to enter a . This method removes the peer from any previously joined room, finds the room intended for join and enqueues the operation for it to handle.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.HandleLeaveOperation(Photon.SocketServer.OperationRequest,Photon.SocketServer.SendParameters)
member.summary: Handles the to leave a .

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.HandlePingOperation(Photon.SocketServer.OperationRequest,Photon.SocketServer.SendParameters)
member.summary: Handles a ping operation.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.OnDisconnect(PhotonHostRuntimeInterfaces.DisconnectReason,System.String)
member.summary: Called when client disconnects. Ensures that disconnected players leave the game . The player is not removed immediately but a message is sent to the room. This avoids threading issues by making sure the player remove is not done concurrently with operations.

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.OnOperationRequest(Photon.SocketServer.OperationRequest,Photon.SocketServer.SendParameters)
member.summary: Called when the client sends an .

member.name: M:Lite.LitePeer.RemovePeerFromCurrentRoom
member.summary: Checks if the the state of peer is set to a reference of a room. If a room refrence is present the peer will be removed from the related room and the reference will be disposed. Disposing the reference allows the associated room factory to remove the room instance if no more references to the room exists.

member.name: P:Lite.LitePeer.RoomReference
member.summary: Gets or sets a when joining a .

member.name: F:Lite.Operations.ParameterKey.DeleteCacheOnLeave
member.summary: Event parameter to indicate whether cached events are deleted automaticly for actors leaving a room.

member.name: F:Lite.Operations.ParameterKey.Group
member.summary: The group this event should be sent to. No error is happening if the group is empty or not existing.

member.name: F:Lite.Operations.ParameterKey.GroupsForRemove
member.summary: Groups to leave. Null won't remove any groups. byte[0] will remove ALL groups. Otherwise only the groups listed will be removed.

member.name: F:Lite.Operations.ParameterKey.GroupsForAdd
member.summary: Groups to enter. Null won't add groups. byte[0] will add ALL groups. Otherwise only the groups listed will be added.

member.name: F:Lite.Operations.ParameterKey.SuppressRoomEvents
member.summary: A parameter indicating if common room events (Join, Leave) will be suppressed.
